name: You Never Regret The Family You Choose — Chapter 1
overview: A grounded emotional mystery that begins with trust, carelessness, and rising fear. The chapter introduces Kaylin Vale, her emotional instability, and the first manifestation of her Star of Ignorance as the player searches for their missing dog, Lune.

scenes.name: Scene 1 — Morning Light, Easy Trust
scenes.content:
Warm early light. Quiet morning routine. Lune padding around the apartment. Kaylin Vale leaning against the counter with sunglasses on from the night before.

MC READ-ALOUD:
“Morning hums with quiet comfort.
Lune trots between your legs, tail thumping against the cabinets.
Kaylin Vale leans on your counter, phone in hand, sunglasses still on indoors like she’s on the tail end of last night’s glow.

She laughs at something you didn’t hear.
For a moment, everything feels easy.”

Kaylin Dialogue Palette:
- “Okay, okay — listen. I cannot be late again. That gallery is life or death.”
- “You’re my grounding wire, babe. My reality check.”
- “Wait — WAIT — I have an idea. Let me take Lune today. Seriously! It’ll help you focus, and she LOVES me.”
- “What’s that face? I promise—like actually promise—I can handle it.”
- “Oh come on… trust me. One tiny favor.”

MC Note: The player should be hesitant.

Player Prompt:
“What is it about Kaylin’s tone that makes you hesitate: her confidence, her frenetic energy, or the way she assumes you’ll say yes?”

Status Tags Awarded:
- If the player agrees easily → Open-Hearted-1
- If the player hesitates → Gut-Feeling-1
- If the player questions her → Unsettled-1

Scene Summary:
Kaylin leaves with Lune. The mood is warm but uneasy.

scenes.name: Scene 2 — The Evening Call
scenes.content:
Setting: Soft rain, quiet apartment, Lune not home yet.

MC READ-ALOUD:
“Rain freckles the window as you clean up after dinner.
Lune should be home by now — you told Kaylin she just needed a walk and a cuddle, nothing complicated.

Your phone buzzes. Kaylin’s name.
One text. Then another.”

Text 1: “Minor chaos. Don’t freak out!”
Text 2: “Lune bolted when thunder hit. She’ll come back.”

Branching begins. Player chooses CALL, TEXT, SEARCH ALONE, or FREEZE.

Full Branching Decision Tree Included:

PATH A — CALL KAYLIN IMMEDIATELY:
Tags Gained: Pushing-For-Truth-1, Fractured-Trust-1, Kaylin’s-Deflection-1
Mechanical Effects: +1 to investigation rolls, –1 to Kaylin’s cooperation later.

PATH B — TEXT FIRST:
Tags: Swallowed-Hurt-1, Trying-To-Trust-1, Slow-Burn-Doubt-1
Mechanical: –1 Resist emotional manipulation, +1 empathy-based moves.

PATH C — SEARCH ALONE:
Tags: Taking-Control-1, Storm-Of-Feelings-1, Alone-In-This-1
Mechanical: +1 search rolls, Kaylin easier to read.

PATH D — FREEZE:
Tags: Frozen-1, Numb-1, Overwhelmed-1
Mechanical: –1 early investigative rolls.

Scene Summary:
Concern turns into dread. The investigation begins.

scenes.name: Scene 3 — Searching for Lune (with Mini-Confrontations)
scenes.content:
Universal Start:
“The rain has gone from sharp to steady... You call Lune’s name through the quiet streets.”

Branch Fold-In:
Integrates all four Scene 2 branches. Variants written for:
- Call-first Kaylin (defensive, rattled)
- Text-first Kaylin (soft, minimizing)
- Search-alone-first (player finds Lune’s tennis ball before Kaylin arrives)
- Freeze-first (Kaylin irritated)

Universal Investigation:
Clue 1 — Neighbor saw Kaylin leave the gate open.
Clue 2 — Phone timeline inconsistency.
Clue 3 — Half-deleted voice memo.
Clue 4 — Found collar (unclipped, not broken).

Early Mini-Confrontations (max 2):
Mini-Confrontation #1 — “Why didn’t you tell me immediately?”
Mini-Confrontation #2 — “Your timeline doesn’t add up.”
Mini-Confrontation #3 — Vulnerability confrontation.

Each Mini-Confrontation:
Success → Kaylin’s Ignorance Limit –1
Partial → Mask cracks slightly, –1
Failure → Kaylin becomes defensive; player gains Self-Doubt.

Scene Summary:
Emotional pressure builds. When clues or tension peak → transition to Scene 4.

scenes.name: Scene 4 — The Park & The Mask
scenes.content:
The confrontation where Kaylin’s Star of Ignorance manifests.

MC READ-ALOUD:
“As you step into the park... Kaylin stands under the lamp holding Lune’s collar… Unclipped.”

Kaylin’s emotional spirals for every branch.
The Mask appears: mirrored visor of fractured spotlight shards.

Kaylin’s Ignorance Monologue (Original):
“You always want me to be perfect... If people don’t need me, they leave.”

Transition Trigger:
Player confronts, comforts, asks for truth, or emotional tension peaks.

Transition to Scene 5:
Visor cracks. Reality folds. Inner Space forms.

innerSpace.description: Scene 5 — INNER SPACE: EMPTY APPLAUSE. A surreal theater where Kaylin’s insecurities become five physical manifestations—each one a lock tied to her Ignorance Limit.

coreWounds.name: Lock 1 — The Lonely Spotlight
coreWounds.description: A single blinding spotlight that isolates Kaylin and represents her fear of irrelevance.

approaches.talkItOut: Tell her she doesn't need to perform to be seen.
approaches.care: Step into the spotlight beside her.
approaches.slay: Turn away and reject the performance entirely.

coreWounds.name: Lock 2 — The Audience of Mirrors
coreWounds.description: Rows of mirrors clapping endlessly—representing her reliance on external validation.

approaches.talkItOut: Expose the falseness of their applause.
approaches.care: Offer genuine praise instead of performative attention.

coreWounds.name: Lock 3 — The Ribbon Leash
coreWounds.description: Child-Kaylin holding a glowing ribbon leash symbolizing abandonment fears.

approaches.talkItOut: Tell her it’s okay to let go.
approaches.care: Uncurl her fingers from the leash gently.
approaches.slay: Cut the leash with firm boundaries.

coreWounds.name: Lock 4 — The Cracked Visor
coreWounds.description: Kaylin’s mask flickers between confidence and fear.

approaches.talkItOut: Show her you're not the enemy.

coreWounds.name: Lock 5 — The Empty Stage
coreWounds.description: The silent stage amplifying the player’s heartbeat instead of their voice.

approaches.slay: Claim the silence instead of fearing it.

outcomes.description: Kaylin breaks open emotionally and chooses honesty.
outcomes.nextChapterImpact: +1 empathy-based moves with Kaylin in Chapter 2

outcomes.description: Kaylin accepts the boundary and leaves, emotionally shaken.
outcomes.nextChapterImpact: +1 Resist rolls, stronger boundaries in future scenes

aftermath.script:
SCENE 6 — AFTERMATH
Setting: Park at night, rain stopped.
Lune is safe.
Kaylin stands small and vulnerable.

Two Ending Paths:

ENDING 1 — REDEEMED:
MC READ-ALOUD:
“Kaylin crumples, shoulders trembling. She finally lets the truth spill.”
Dialogue:
“I thought if I sparkled enough… I’d matter.”
“I want to do better.”

ENDING 2 — NOT REDEEMED:
MC READ-ALOUD:
“You step back. Kaylin’s face tightens—not in anger, but in heartbreak.”
Dialogue:
“I need help… but not from you.”

DOWNTIME 1 — Reflection After Betrayal
Setting: Player’s apartment at night; Lune beside them.
MC READ-ALOUD:
“Night settles in as you return home… You have a moment to breathe.”
Player may choose:
- Reflection
- Support from Lune
- Routine/Grounding
- Create Something

If Redeemed: gain emotional clarity or hope.
If Not Redeemed: gain boundaries or inner healing.

consequences.description: The emotional fallout from Kaylin’s carelessness and the first rupture of her Star of Ignorance.
